info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 19 at 3:56PM MDT until May 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico... Southeastern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 600 PM MDT.
* At 355 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Chaparral, moving east at 45 mph.
HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong winds up to 45 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 134 and 164. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 10. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 158. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 30.
Locations impacted include... Chaparral, Orogrande, Las Cruces, Anthony, Vado, White Sands Missile Range Headquarters, NMSU Main Campus, Dona Ana, Anthony Gap, Berino, Mesilla, San Miguel, Mesquite, Chamberino, Fairacres, McGregor Range Base, Talavera, La Mesa, and High Valley.
info.instruction: Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
